'''Gigi Ibrahim''' ({{lang-ar|Ø¬ÙØ¬Ù Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§ÙÙÙ}}, {{IPA-arz|ËÊiËÊi ebrË¤ÉËhiËm|IPA}}) is an [[Egyptian]] [[journalist]], [[blogger]] and [[socialist]] activist. +
'''Gigi Ibrahim''' ({{lang-ar|Ø¬ÙÙØ§Ù Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§ÙÙÙ}}, {{IPA-arz|ËÊiËÊi ebrË¤ÉËhiËm|IPA}}) is an [[Egyptian]] [[journalist]], [[blogger]] and [[socialist]] activist. She has been credited as being a part of a new generation of "citizen journalists" who document news events using [[social media]]. For this she was featured on a cover of [[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] magazine as "one of the leaders" of [[Tahrir Square]] during the [[Egyptian Revolution 2011|Egyptian Revolution]] in 2011.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.dailycamera.com/features/ci_17742185 | title = The world at Boulder's doorstep | publisher = Daily Camera | date = 4 March 2011 | accessdate = 12 April 2011}}</ref> Ibrahim however states, that while the internet was important for coordinating people in the ousting of [[President of Egypt|President]] [[Hosni Mubarak]], "it was the battles on the streets that were crucial... It was their power that made the revolution."
â

Ibrahim however states, that while the internet was important for coordinating people in the ousting of [[President of Egypt|President]] [[Hosni Mubarak]], "it was the battles on the streets that were crucial... It was their power that made the revolution."
  â
She is a graduate from the [[American University in Cairo]]<ref>{{cite web
+
She is a graduate from the [[American University in Cairo]]<ref>{{cite web | url = http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/01/27/interview-with-an-egyptian-blogger/ | title = Interview With an Egyptian Blogger | publisher = The New York Times | date = 27 January 2011 | accessdate = 12 April 2011}}</ref> where she earned a political science degree.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://journalism.about.com/b/2011/01/28/citizen-journalist-gigi-ibrahim-uses-tools-of-the-web-to-spread-news-of-cairo-protests.htm | title = Citizen Journalist Gigi Ibrahim Uses Tools of the Web to Spread News of Cairo Protests | publisher = About.com | date = 28 January 2011 | accessdate = 14 April 2011}}</ref> Prior to university, Gigi has had no direct links to the [[Politics of Egypt#Civil society|workers protests]] and [[List of political parties in Egypt|opposition movements]] that had previously been occurring in Egypt. It was a class on "Social Mobilization under Authoritarian Regimes", lectured by [[Hossam el-Hamalawy]], that provided her with insight about activism in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=33189 | title = Egyptian activist on The Daily Show | publisher = Bikya Masr | date = 27 April 2011 | accessdate = 1 May 2011}}</ref> The contact with el-Hamalawy, a member of the [[Revolutionary Socialists (Egypt)|Revolutionary Socialists]], led her to decide to join the movement.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.socialistworker.co.uk/art.php?id=24165 | title = Socialist from Egypt to join debate about revolution | publisher = Socialist Worker (UK) | date = 12 March 2011 | accessdate = 19 March 2011}}</ref>

Prior to university, Gigi has had no direct links to the [[Politics of Egypt#Civil society|workers protests]] and [[List of political parties in Egypt|opposition movements]] that had previously been occurring in Egypt. It was a class on "Social Mobilization under Authoritarian Regimes", lectured by [[Hossam el-Hamalawy]], that provided her with insight about activism in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web
  â
| url = http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=33189
  â
| title = Egyptian activist on The Daily Show
  â
| publisher = Bikya Masr
  â
| date = 27 April 2011
  â
| accessdate = 1 May 2011
  â
}}</ref>
  â
The contact with el-Hamalawy, a member of the [[Revolutionary Socialists (Egypt)|Revolutionary Socialists]], led her to decide to join the movement.<ref>{{cite web
  â
| url = http://www.socialistworker.co.uk/art.php?id=24165
  â
| title = Socialist from Egypt to join debate about revolution
  â
| publisher = Socialist Worker (UK)
  â
| date = 12 March 2011
  â
| accessdate = 19 March 2011
  â
}}</ref>
 
Aside from ''Time'', she has also appeared in [[Frontline (U.S. TV series)|Frontline]], [[BBC News|BBC]], [[Al Jazeera]] and the [[Daily Show]].
Aside from ''Time'', she has also appeared in [[Frontline (U.S. TV series)|Frontline]], [[BBC News|BBC]], [[Al Jazeera]] and the [[Daily Show]].
â
She is critical of other Egyptian youth activists such as [[Wael Ghonim]], who called on protesters to go home after Mubarak had ceded some power but refused to step down as President.<ref>{{cite web
